Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Intravenous Preemptive Analgesia in Vitreoretinal Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: randomly assigned to receive AoA-guided GA combined with IPA at a single dose of 1 g of paracetamol, 2.5 g of metamizole, or both

Participants.evidence: 165 patients scheduled for VRS at the Department of Ophthalmology, 5th Regional Hospital in Sosnowiec

Intervention.evidence: IPA at a single dose of 1 g of paracetamol, 2.5 g of metamizole, or both

Objective.evidence: aimed to evaluate the impact of intravenous preemptive analgesia (IPA) with cyclooxygenase-3 (COX-3) inhibitors

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of PONV, OCR, and OER, measured within 24 hours postoperatively

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using sealed envelopes, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors and patients

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 165 patients scheduled for VRS

Result_Outcome.evidence: PONV occurred in 4%, OCR in 10%, and OER in 0%

Harms.evidence: No significant differences were observed between groups regarding IPA type
